Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: with slightly less rounded blade than last and thinner in section. It has a single binding-hole, centrally positioned near the butt. The butt is more or less straight. The piece is lightly corroded, and the line of the haft is preserved. The cutting edge was never sharpened and shows no signs of wear.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (52)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
